sen.j: 藤原 実宗（ふじわら の さねむね、久安元年（1145年） - 建保元年12月9日 (旧暦)（1214年1月21日））は、平安時代後期から鎌倉時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sanemune (1145-January 28, 1214) was Kugyo (the top court official) who lived from the late Heian period to the early Kamakura period.

sen.e: He served in eight generations from the Emperor Konoe (the seventy-sixth) to the Emperor Tsuchimikado (the eighty-third) during the unquiet days, and promoted up to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Naidaijin (a minister).

sen.j: 以降、侍従・右近衛少将・備後介・伊予権介・讃岐介などを経て、嘉応2年（1170年）蔵人頭となる。
sen.e: After experiencing jiju (a chamberlain), Ukone no shosho (a minor captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Bingo no suke (an assistant governor of Bingo Province), Iyo no Gon no Suke (a provincial vice governor of Iyo Province), Sanuki no suke (a deputy governor of the Province of Sanuki) and other positions, he became Kurodo no to (a head chamberlain) in 1170.

sen.j: 備前権守・権中納言を経て、文治5年（1189年）に権大納言に就任した。
sen.e: After experiencing Bizen gon no kami (a provincial governor of Bizen Province) and Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state), he became Gon Dainagon (a provisional major councilor) in 1189.

sen.j: 建久9年（1198年）土御門天皇践祚の大嘗祭検校をつとめ、元久2年（1205年）には内大臣に任じられるも、翌建永元年（1206年）3月13日に辞職、11月27日に出家した。
sen.e: Though he served as Daijosai Kengyo in accession (to the throne) of the Emperor Tsuchimikado in 1198 and was appointed to Naidaijin in 1205, he resigned on April 29, 1206 and entered into priesthood on January 4, 1207.
